page.title: 15Culcreuch House: FINTRY
page.content:
Culcreuch House (or Castle) styled as the ancestral home of{Clan Galbraith was originally a stronghold of the Graham family who had a castle off the Denny road (now a ruin). Since being sold by the Galbraiths,Culcreuch House has passed through many hands.
The 'Castle' so titled by a recent owner is situated at the foot of the Fintry Hills. It is an imposing place in an impressive setting, overlooking a loch and fine wooded policies, including a{pinetum of rare trees. The earlier part{1320}and the medieval tower{1460}have walls over 5 ft thick. Among its features is a{bottle dungeon and{aumbray}and some very fine old panelling. A{Georgian wing }was added later, this has a fine{Georgian spiral {staircase}that leads to the top of the fourth storey.
